page.title: 04TRAFFIC IN HIGH WYCOMBE
page.content: Until recently,the{A40,}linking {London to Oxford}and passing through High Wycombe's town centre bore most of the traffic, frquently bringing the town to a stand still.In{1967}work was started to constuct a{relief road, from Oxford Road in the west, over the precint to the A40 in Easton Street. This has relieved traffic in Frogmoor and the High Street. Then a new motorway, the{M40,}was built,allowing much of the traffic to by-pass High Wycombe. The main{A404}leads North to{Amersham and beyond,while,to the South,{Marlow Hill links the centre of town with the new{M40}motorway between{London}and {Oxford.}High Wycombe is also linked by {rail}to London. Thus, High Wycombe is in a good situation, having good road links with London, the South East,the West and the Midlands.
